Package com.berbils.game.Entities.FireStation

Class FireStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.BoxGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.Entities.FireStation.FireStation
  • public class FireStation
extends BoxGameEntity
    Creates a fire station body and fixture that the player can interact with through contact

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity

        catBits, entityBody, entityBodyDefinition, entityFixture, entityFixtureDefinition, entityShape, entitySprite, isStatic, maskBits, position, screen, sizeDims, spriteHandler, spriteLayer, userData, world

      Creates a Box2D body, fixture and then an attached sprite using the passed in arguments with the appropriate properties for this type of game object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void collided​(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture fixture)
      The method for determining what occurs on collision with the fire station object.The current screen shown is updated and the contacted object is destroyed if it is a fire engine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireStation

        public FireStation​(PlayScreen screen,
                   com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 pos,
                   com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 sizeDims,
                   java.lang.String textureFilePath)
        Creates a Box2D body, fixture and then an attached sprite using the passed in arguments with the appropriate properties for this type of game object
        Parameters:
        screen - The Screen the Fire Station object is located on and will be created
        pos - The position in meters where the fire station should be created with the center of the fire station being at this position.
        sizeDims - The size of the body,fixture and sprite in meters
        textureFilePath - The file path to the texture for the sprite, * NOTE - If this is null a sprite will * not be created

    • Method Detail

      • collided

        public void collided​(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture fixture)
        The method for determining what occurs on collision with the fire station object.The current screen shown is updated and the contacted object is destroyed if it is a fire engine.
        Parameters:
        fixture - The fixture that collided with the object instance
